title: Food Sources and Types
description: Learn about different sources of food and distinguish between plant and animal products.

questions.question: Which of these is a plant product?
questions.explanation: Rice is a plant product as it comes from the rice plant, while milk, eggs, and honey are animal products.

questions.question: What type of food do herbivores eat?
questions.explanation: Herbivores are animals that eat only plants or plant products.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a source of food?
questions.explanation: Minerals are not a direct source of food, while plants, animals, and some microorganisms can be sources of food.

questions.question: What do we call animals that eat both plants and meat?
questions.explanation: Omnivores are animals that eat both plants and meat, like humans and bears.

questions.question: Which part of a plant do we eat in the case of carrots?
questions.explanation: Carrots are roots of the plant that we eat.

questions.question: What type of food do carnivores eat?
questions.explanation: Carnivores are animals that eat only meat or other animals.

questions.question: Which of these is an animal product?
questions.explanation: Cheese is an animal product as it is made from milk, while wheat, corn, and potatoes are plant products.

questions.question: What do we call the process of plants making their own food?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants make their own food using sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide.

questions.question: Which of these is a source of protein?
questions.explanation: Eggs are a good source of protein, while rice, bread, and potatoes are mainly sources of carbohydrates.

questions.question: What do we call animals that eat dead and decaying matter?
questions.explanation: Decomposers are organisms that break down dead and decaying matter, helping in nutrient recycling.
